intro: Correa glabra, commonly known as the smooth correa, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of bright red or orange flowers. Correa glabra is also valued for its ability to attract native pollinators such as birds and insects.
